German Chancellor Bismarck sits at a table covered with the map of Europe. On the wall behind him are a map of Russia (left) and the three emperors of the Three Emperors’ League (right), with the German emperor covering the faces of the Austrian and Russian emperors.
content.question: Which of the following best explains why some members of the British public may have been sympathetic to Bismarck's foreign policy?

choices.label: Bismarck’s alliance system was designed to isolate France, which was also Britain’s longtime rival.
Like Britain, Bismarck’s Germany also sought to acquire colonial territories in Africa.
Bismarck’s dismissal from office would heighten diplomatic tensions among European states.
Like Britain, Bismarck’s Germany had also undertaken significant industrial development and created a consumer economy.

content.answer: Bismarck’s alliance system was designed to isolate France, which was also Britain’s longtime rival.
